meanings.definition: A person who grants a feoffment.
meanings.sent1: The feoffor handed over the land deed to the new owner.
meanings.sent2: The feoffor transferred ownership of the estate to his son.
meanings.sent3: The feoffor accidentally gave away the wrong property deed!
meanings.sent4: She was the feoffor of dreams, bestowing them upon those in need.
meanings.sent5: The feoffor, with a grand gesture, bestowed the title upon the humble farmer.

meanings.definition: A person who transfers land or property by feoffment.
meanings.sent1: The feoffor signed the legal documents to transfer the estate.
meanings.sent2: The feoffor completed the transaction by handing over the keys.
meanings.sent3: The feoffor joked that he was now officially a land courier!
meanings.sent4: She was known as the feoffor of fortunes, passing on wealth to others.
meanings.sent5: The feoffor's actions spoke louder than words, as the property changed hands smoothly.
